text: was a Japanese actress and singer. She was the daughter of J-pop star Seiko Matsuda and actor Masaki Kanda. ==Career== In 1999, while a student at a Japanese school in Los Angeles, she appeared in Bean Cake. The short film won the Palme d'Or du court métrage at the 2001 Cannes Film Festival. In 2005, she released a DVD called Dolls. She made her Kōhaku Uta Gassen debut in the 62nd Kōhaku Uta Gassen (12/31/2011) singing Ue wo muite arukō with her mother, Seiko Matsuda."【紅白歌合戦】神田沙也加、松田聖子と親娘で出場 「心強いです」 ." Oricon News. 30 November 2011. ==Death== Kanda died after jumping from the fourteenth floor of her hotel room in Sapporo, Japan on December 18, 2021. She was 35 years old. ==Discography== ===Singles=== * "Ever Since" (2002) * "Garden" (2003) * "Mizu Iro" (2004) * "Jougen no Tsuki" (2005) ===Albums=== * Doll (2005) * Liberty (2011) ==Filmography== * Bean Cake (2001) * Dragon Head (2003) * School Wars: Hero (2004) * HEY JAPANESE! Do you believe PEACE, LOVE and UNDERSTANDING? (2007) * Farewell, Kamen Rider Den-O: Final Countdown (2008) * Amazing Grace (2010) * Geki×Cine Bara to Samurai(2011) == References == == Other websites == * White Parasol * Category:1986 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Singers from Tokyo Category:Actors from Tokyo Category:Suicides by jumping Category:Japanese voice actors Category:Japanese movie actors Category:Japanese television actors
title: Sayaka Kanda
